result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th) and Operating w/ PAC (8th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (8th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael Patrick Obermiller was found guilty of OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00, costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance due prior to the end of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment. Follow up care and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a biological specimen/DNA to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearm/weapons at any time in the future.  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Patrick Obermiller

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN: RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVENUE CHIPPEWA FALLS, WI 54729

Filed and Distributed;  Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br.18, Judge COLON.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment was returned because he has not served the applicable percentage of confinement time pursuant to section 973.195, Stats.
Petition for Sentence Adjustment.
Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (26 pages) commencing 06/26/2015 received and filed.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  Additional statement made by his sponsor and friend Roy S.

AS TO COUNT 1:    COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS, with credit for 147 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.      Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

The Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
The Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO THE EXTENDED SUPERVISON:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screen with no positive results.
*  Pay a fine of $600.00 up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / weapons at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  3 YEARS suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee. 
*  3 YEARS Ignition Interlock Device

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for Catelin Ringersma for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNT 1 (OWI 8th):  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty. Christopher Ertl on behalf of the defendant.
and Addendum filed by Atty. Christopher Ertl on behalf of the defendant.

Parties request an adjournment.
Case adjourned to 06-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Defendant filed three PRO SE motions with the Court:  (1) Motion to Suppress Statements, (2) Motion to Proceed Pro Se, (3) Motion to Withdraw Plea.
Statements made.
Defendant withdraws all PRO SE motions filed with the Court AND the District Attorneys office.
Case adjourned to 06-05-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for status of counsel.
Atty. Christopher Ertl is now the attorney of record for the defendant.
Case adjourned to 05-01-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Kastenson previously filed a motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
The attorney/client relationship is broken.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Kastenson to withdraw.
**Atty. Daryl Kastenson is now discharged.
Atty. Kastenson to ensure that new counsel is appointed for the defendant by the next court date.
Case adjourned to 03-16-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record filed by Atty. Daryl Kastenson.
entered by defense.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.

Atty. Kastenson moves to withdraw as counsel for the defendant. 
No objections.
Court GRANTS motion and "allows" Atty. Kastenson to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
**Atty. Daryl Kastenson is now discharged.
Case adjourned to 02-26-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
Received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Michael Patrick Obermiller in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
